result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM Defendant Michael A. Gordon appeared by phone.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Michael A. Gordon.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty reviewed charges and potential penalties, waives reading, plead NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
ACJ payment receipt, Bail Bond Info Sheet from ACJ, Notice RE Posting Bond form and a copy of signed cash bond

1:46 PM Defendant Michael A. Gordon appeared by phone.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Michael A. Gordon.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, def waiving right to prelim hearing.  Def agrees waiving right to prelim hearing, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed amended complaint and finds PC that def has committed a felony in Ashland County, case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information that mirrors the same count as in the amended complaint.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on October 13;  ka

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.

1:00 PM Defendant Michael A. Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Michael A. Gordon.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Warrant is quashed, order forfeiting bond is vacated.  State comments on bail/bond.  Atty comments on bail/bond.  Atty, recv'd copy of complaint, waive time limits for prelim hearing.  Def agrees.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
